Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Traveller271192
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed from the 11th-15th of April and the most fantastic weekend. We checked in with a girl who spoke fantastic English, she wasn't overly friendly, but got the job done. (there were other members if staff who were more than happy to help us out). Our room was on the 6th floor with a huge bed (enough space for 4 people!), a small stand-out balcony and an incredibly powerful shower. At night you could hear traffic etc outside, but not nearly enough to keep you up, or wake you up. The hotel itself is slightly out of the centre of town, but no more than a 10 minute walk to the busy main streets of Passeig de Gracia and La Rambla, where you will find all the best restaurants and designer shops. (is also very easy access by train from the airport) The Sagrada Familia is also only 10-15 minutes walk from the hotel and a brilliant sight to see. There is also a zoo, maybe 40-45 minutes walk from the hotel, definitely worth a visit. It is possible to get a metro to all of these places, but with such beautiful weather and surroundings, we found it best to walk. The hotel lobby as a selection of leaflets etc, we found one with a map and we used it to plan our days, it was fantastic. The PortAventura theme park is also only 90 mins away and so easily accessible by train from Passeig de Gracia. We purely used the room as a base to shower and sleep and it was perfect for that. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom provided more than enough amenities. I would gladly return to the Hesperia Carlit and after this experience, stay in any other Hesperia hotels worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: KTBristol83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our 3 day trip to Barcelona and it was a great hotel. Situated in a quiet area but only 2 metro stops from main tourist and restaurant locations. There are some really nice bars and restaurants near by also. You can walk to the l'Example district in 15 mins for excellent wine and tapas. The hotel had excellent service and cleanliness was outstanding. Rooms are simple and modern, no frills as such but perfect to relax in after a long day walking around. The only thing i would say is to ask for a street-view upgrade higher up, it's only 10E extra per night but worth it...the new room we had was much much bigger with great bathroom and balcony overlooking the local area. Free wireless for iPad in lobby also a bonus. Would def recommend this as a well priced and pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value priced; decent location”
Reviews.Author: The3ofus60614
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very reasonably priced for being in a major city. That said, the acommodations are straightforward, no luxury. The furniture is modern but don't expect a comfortable chair. This is truly a "bed sitter." The bathroom is very well sized for a European hotel. It also offers individual-room heating/airconditioning. It is about 2 blocks to the Metro but the line it is on usually requires transfers to get around the city. The adjacent area offers a good to excellent mix of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: MalteseTravelBuff
Reviews.Content: This was not my first trip to Barcelona and I usually book the hotel myself but I let a work colleague do it for me this time, giving my specifications of which area we wanted to stay in. We checked in with a friendly receptionist who spoke very good English and the hotel looked very nice. The first room we were given was not to my liking, it was more of a cupboard rather than a bedroom so I walked back down to the front desk and asked for a better one. The second room given was much better though no views but I wanted space and that's what we got. The furnishings were nice and modern as was the bathroom and we did enjoy our stay. Good hotel with very easy access to the underground and easy location to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure stay at Hesperia Carlit hotel - Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived on an earlier flight from Luton and at reception (1200hrs) we expected just to drop off our bags and go exploring. The receptionist checked if they had our room available and it was ready. This shows that where possible the staff will assist guests and not just stick to the rules (+2pm check-in). The receptionist also gave us some maps and asked us what we were going to do whilst in Barcelona so that she could give us relevant bus / tube timetables. We were offered breakfast in the hotel at a discounted rate but we did not have breakfast in the hotel. tThe staff did not try to force breakfast on us. We were left alone to enjoy the city at our own pace. The only issue i have is that the room prices on easy to book are shown in Pounds and when you pay it is converted into Euros at a not very favorable rate so a 4 night stay was about £25 more expensive than we anticipated. The hotel is away from the tourist centre of the Ramblas and is a little cheaper. I choose the hotel as it was central to go to the Familia Sagrada and to Guell park. yet close enough to walk to the Ramblas - 15mins away. You also get a good nights sleep. I would go again as a couple or as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: stan1129
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Not corporate-feeling (even though it's part of a chain) at all. Helpful and friendly staff.Don't bother with their breakfast and go to a bakery/pastry shop around the corner with excellent coffee and breads. The location is a little far, if you walk, from Placa Catalunya (where all the action begins) but there is a subway stop a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel near Placa de Tetuan”
Reviews.Author: jmcbalt
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed six nights stay at the Hesperia Carlit. It is a comfortable hotel a few blocks from the Placa de Tetuan, several blocks from the Placa de Catalunya. The room was comfortable and the bed large. Although I requested a room for one person, in addition to the bed there was a foldaway bed unfolded -- it remained in the room for the length of my stay. Mildly inconvenient, since it blocked the window, but not a problem. My luggage was delayed by three days, and the front desk staff was very helpful in terms of advice for replacing clothes and toiletries until they arrived. Wifi was free in the lobby, and the breakfast (9.20E, not included in the room rate I booked) looked filling.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: mickeymouseScotland
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time in the Hesperia Carlit hotel in Barcelona. The bed was MASSIVE and the rooms were immaculate. The staff were very friendly and helpful and always had a cheery smile when we arrived back. FREE wifi in the lobby and free use of a computer to print off our online checkin for our return flights. I would 100% recommend this hotel, and fully intend on returning the next time we're lucky enough to visit this amazing city. ALSO you MUST visit the AMAZING Argentinian Restuarant "Alfonsina" which is just two doors down from the hotel, for THE BEST steak you will ever eat, and also utterly perfect friendly and informative service. we really heart Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Paul_D_Dublin
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel. Stayed in a double room that was airy and spacious. No complaints at all about bed quality, bathroom, room cleaning or anything like that, everything was very professionally run and managed. Room was very well soundproofed, so didn't hear any noise from outside. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and spoke English if need be. The hotel is in a quiet area of the city, but there are still some bars and restaurants nearby. It's possible to walk to Placa de Catalunya fairly easily if you want. Otherwise, the Tetuan metro station is nearby, and it's only a few stops to La Rambla and the old city. It probably won't be the cheapest hotel you can find in Barcelona, but represents very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when you travel Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: israelb99
Reviews.Content: We (2 freinds) spent 3 nights in Barcelona and had a wonderful time. It's very nice hotel with friendly staff, at a great location. The room was big and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with friendly staff, at a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week in October 2011. It's conveniently located between Sagrada familia and La Rambla, and also two blocks from the metro stop. From the moment we checked in, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, surpassing any hotel I've been to. The room was big, with unexpectedly big bathroom; both were clean. The mattress was quite hard, and a joy to sleep on. The noise from the street could be heard, but was not loud enough to cause problems. Breakfast is really nice, and worth the price (I believe it was 12€; there's substantial discount if you buy it for more than three days). I have nothing to complain about. If I return to Barcelona, I will definitely stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HoosierRoots
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here recently after our cruise. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly, spoke English and was very helpful. We had a room facing the street and it was very noisy at night. Turns out we were there during a holiday in Spain and if a holiday occurs on Tuesday or Thursday, they also take Monday or Friday off for a 4 day weekend. Breakfast was very good. Fresh baked breads and croissants were excellent. Cost of breakfast is 2 euros less if you purchase it when you check in. I'd recommend it. Hotel is within walking distance of "hop on, hop off sightseeing buses" and the Metro. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: AndreiSavich
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Barcelona we have decide to prolong our stay for one more night and because our previous hotel (NH Duc la la Victoria) had been fully booked, we have moved to the Hesperia Carlit. Hotel is clean and quiet; a staff is very friendly and helpful. We got room on the 6th floor facing to the school stadium and with famous Sagrada Familia view. Hotel located just in 700m from Sagrada Familia and 900m from Arc the Triumph by walk. From the city centre, you can reach the hotel by metro (stop Tetuan) it would take less then 15 min including walking or by buses. To plan your moving around I would recommend to use the Transports Metropolitans de Barcelona portal www.tmb.cat. It’s very helpful tool.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay that exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Meemschirk
Reviews.Content: We extended our Barcelona trip and needed a new place, quickly, for five nights. We were hesitant about the Hesperia Carlit based on mediocre Tripadvisor comments but had limited options. So we're pleased to report we had a very pleasant stay. Quiet was of paramount importance and we got a room facing a school courtyard, which was great since school is out, and a view of the Sagrada Familia. It was on the 6th floor, which unfortunately is the smoking floor, so we lived with some odor for the first few days--the air conditioner is weak and did not help blow out the smoke as quickly as it could have. They offered to move us but we liked everything else about the room so opted to stay. We had twin beds that were quite firm, but acceptable. Location is a little further out than we usually like, though blocks from the Sagrada Familia. We're serious walkers so found it a good trek to the gothic quarters, to the beach, and to to Park Guell. Many metro stops all around. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English well! Th The room was basic, with a small fridge, good water pressure in the shower. The bedside lights were broken but they fixed them quickly. The TV was upgraded while we were there. Internet is available with an ethernet cable they provide. We didn't originally sign up for breakfast but had it four days to load us up--excellent expresso, juices, croissants, cereals, fresh fruits, etc. Pricey but can hold you well into the afternoon. The

Reviews.Title: “Great base for an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Taylors-Wilts
Reviews.Content: Three of us went on a cultural trip on a budget & really enjoyed staying in this hotel, we were very happy with our single rooms. It was clean, each room had a toilet, sink & shower ensuite with shower gel, shower cap, toothbrush, toothpaste, soap & sponge provided - useful to know if you are taking hand luggage only. Each room has air con you can control, a tv (mainly Spanish!), haridryer and a fridge mini bar, with a desk & chair. The window opened which was nice to have some fresh air, and the rooms we had were at the back of the hotel which overlooked a childrens football pitch. There isnt a bar, pool, gym or anything but its a great base camp for being out & about in the city. I slept really well and found it quiet - other guests seemed to be mature and fairly quiet although one of my friends was next to some very excitable chatty girls who kept him awake. We didnt have breakfast as it was quite expensive even at discounted 9 euros - there are cafes nearby but we got bits from the supermarket opposite and had croissants etc in the room, there was spare space in the fridge for ham & cheese.. The only thing it lacked was tea making facilities which we British love, although one of my friends had a travel kettle with him! The area the hotel is in is residential and reasonably quiet, its not a main road although there are shops, cafes etc Its a short walk to the metro and within easy walking distance of the main town - its all flat and in blocks so you can follow a map fairly easily. I think if you wanted lively nightlife it s bit away from the action. The staff were very helpful & checking in & out was quick - just ask if you need anything - I borrowed an iron and got them to order a taxi and they were very efficient. Taxi to the airport was 33 euros. They were happy to store bags after checking out, until we picked them up later that evening. There is so much to see in Barcelona its hard to decide - we took a Tourist bus tour for orientation & to see the range of places to visit. The main Gaudi attractions are so popular and quite pricy that we decided to just do La Pedreira (fantastic!), and got up early to be first in the queue at 9am, if you leave it later the queue will be very long, same with Casa Batllo & Miro museum. Dont bother with the museum of modern art - it was a big building but there wasnt much to it. Parc Guell is great but very busy indeed & up a steep hill. We loved the Museu de ceramica which is out of the main centre, near the University, but also houses a textile museum & interiors museum in a fabulous building, cheaper & much less crowded but fascinating. We loved all the narrow streets in & around the Ramblas, Ribera & Barri Gottic, especially the big market with amazing food. Overall a great trip & I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Bruns
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia hotel, is placed in central Barcelona, its only a 10-15 minutte walk away from the Sagrada Familia, and less than 5 minuttes from the nearest subway station. From our window on the 5th floor we could actually see the top of the Sagrada Familia. There are a few restaurants and bars in the immidiate area, but I would advice to travel a bit closer to the center of town for eating. We had breakfast at the hotel, and this was ok, with one exception: The bacon tasted as if it was cooked. But compared to the general none exsistence of breakfast in Spain, i'd defenatly recommend bying at the hotel. Our room was quite small, there was only room, for a small desk, a minibar and our bed. The bathroom was ok in size. And who stays at the hotelroom for anything else than sleeping anyway ? The room where somewhat worn. The staff spoke excellent english, and where very friendly and helpfull. I'd recommend staying at this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: vleeca
Reviews.Content: Expect a basic room with no frills. The room is clean and in a safe neighborhood, the staff are friendly and speaks English. The distance from La Rambla is about a 20-30 minute walk, mid-way to La rambla is a quiet but safe neighborhood. You are better off not getting the breakfast from the hotel (list price of 12 Euro but offered at the hotel for about 9 including tax), there are 3 restaurants beside the hotel where you are get breakfast (cappicino with croissant or ham & cheese sandwich) for less than 3 Euro. Beware of pick pockets in Barcelona - especially at metro stations and La Rambla!!! I got mine picked at a metro station when I had my hands full with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: thelasteast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in March. We were very satisfied with the quality for the price. The room itself was a bit cold with the granite floors, but we managed. The water temperature was cold, but we found that if you trickled the water in the sink, the water in the shower warmed up. My main issue with the room was that there were loud plumbing noises every time a room near us ran water. The first couple of nights this woke us up but then we got used to it. The front desk staff was super nice and accomodating to us foreigners who didn't speak the language. Every time we approached them with a question, or needing assistance for one reason or a another, they were very helpful. My only issue with the front desk is that the night audit clerk wore high heals which woke us up every time she walked through the lobby, as our room overlooked this area. I am a front desk manager and have a habit of judging this department a bit harshly, but this staff did very well! The hotel is decently located. There are a few little restaurants on the block and it's only a few block from La Sagrada Familia. La Rambla and the Gothic Quarter are a short distance away via subway. We liked being further away from the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, friendly staff, quiet area”
Reviews.Author: zoobus
Reviews.Content: The desk staff all spoke excellent English, and were very helpful with every question. The room was spacious and comfortable. Just a little TV but that's not why you go to Barcelona! Good shower, and clean bathroom. No air con but the windows opened and it's a quiet neighbourhood. About 15 minute walk to the big down town area (la Rambla etc), and 10 minute walk to one of the main bus stations which was very helpful if you get a bus from Girona airport. Breakfast was 12 euros (or 9 if you book for your whole stay), and was very nice, classic european hotel fare (bread rolls, meat cheese), plus cereal, fruit etc and a hot option.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilyloo07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hesperia in early May for four nights. We had room 505 overlooking the street which was really nice and the bed is HUGE!!. Room was very clean and my boyfriend was very inpressed with the lovely orange smelly soap! Staff were friendly and very helpful. You can't knock this hotel, the location is great as it is tucked away form the tourist traps and only a few minutes walk from a Metro station, plus good value for money. TIP: *We got a four day metro pass which allows you to use all public transport in the city. Barcelona transport system is the best I have used. *Get the Airbus from the airport for 5 euro then a taxi to the hotel 7-8 euro. *The Cafe on the left across the road is great for a cheap breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: mc4319
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days/4 nights. Great location and within walking distance to Las Ramblas, Sagrada Familia and super easy subway close by. Food/Tapas/Markets were also within walking distance. The staff were great and concerned for your safety. Only quibble other than me snoring was the room(s) seemed paper thin. You could hear every conversation in the rooms next to you. (weird). Bathroom actually had a converter for 110/220 and accommodated, even though it felt like it was on top of the room itself with the glass door. They also had an internet Cat 5 cable which was nice and a small fridge that we put some food stuffs in to keep cold. The cleaning crew were fabulous. Great locale, but the noise factor was dead on when I read the reviews before us.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Barcelona - a gem”
Reviews.Author: Cndw0rldtravlr
Reviews.Content: I just spent 7 nights at this hotel and truely enjoyed my stay. The location is perfect - a 5 minute walk to Tetuan metro station, which is one station away from the famous Passeig de Gracia, and from there you can walk to La Rambla and other touristy spots. If you enjoy walking, the Sagrada Familia is located 15 min walk from the hotel - which by the way i could see from my room. The room was modern, with a nice (and fairly large) bathroom. I must say that the room was spotless clean with a comfortable bed and beddings. The TV was very small and dated but you dont go to BCN to watch TV anyway! Free internet is offered throughout the hotel, but was told wifi only works in the lobby. The receptionist gave me a LAN internet cable which i used during my stay. As per some other guests have stated, the elevator is noisy and the walls quite thin. My room also faced a playground with kids screaming and playing soccer early in the morning. This did not bother me as I always sleep with earplugs. TIP: The minibar is FREE (every day and includes: coca cola, diet coca cola, juices, water, sparkling water, 1 chocolate bar, 1 bag of chips, 2 heineken beers) if you book your stay using their web site. Overall this is a very nice, comfortable, CLEAN, and conveniently located little hotel which I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Noise hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: input039
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel upon the recommendation that it's supposed to be a quiet hotel but unfortunately we don't agree. The 1st night we stayed in a room at the road side and there was a lot of traffic all night and a lot of noise from the hotel elevator. When asked for another room the next day, we got a room in the back of the hotel but with even more noise from the elevator this time the motor from the elevator was located right next/up from our room. A receptionist said that 'you hear the elevator in the entire hotel so can't do much about it'. The elevator is located in the middle of the hotel. Needless to say we didn't sleep a wink that night. The 3rd night a much kinder receptionist gave us a room where the noise of the elevator was less however we woke up at 00.30 from the neigbouring room's occupant's shower and heard everything he said whilst in it. Also we woke up 3 times the next morning from alarm clocks from the occupants in the next rooms and the noise from a school's playground which was in the back of the hotel. We will not stay again at this hotel as we didn't sleep a lot during our 3 nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Busnsandpleasure
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel and good vaue. Staff extremely friendy and helpful, room pleasant and well cleaned. Breakfast plentiful, and within walking distance of most of Barcelona's major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel in the quiet side of barcelona”
Reviews.Author: potterh
Reviews.Content: picked this hotel because of the positive comments from tripadvisor and i am glad that i chose this hotel during my 6 nights stay in Barcelona. it is about 5 min from the metro statin (tetuan) and you can walk to the sagrada familia from the hotel in only 25 minutes. the hotel is new and clean. I had a single room (which is in fact a double room). very spacious and comfortable. the hotel staff are very friendly and gave me very details instructions to places that i want to go. they speak very good english which was very important to me. i did not take the breakfast from the hotel and instead opt for the cafes near the hotel. the cafe con leche and croissant or spanish omlette are something hard to forget. the hotel also offers free wifi. for about 65 euro per night, i am very happy with what i go. i will definately stay there again if i visit barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bathroom”
Reviews.Author: BookingNextTrip
Reviews.Content: Room was a little on the small size for what we paid, although it did have a very nice bathroom and shower. The hotel advertises room service (pizza) and has a menu in English in the rooms but when we were connected the operator couldn't speak English. The hotel was also further from the main attractions than we would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravelCA
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a modern feeling to it, once you step into the lobby. The location is quite a walk from Plaza Catalunya and the Ramblas. At night, walking back from the Ramblas, you walk thru an an area that is a little deserted, until you reach the street on which the hotel is located ((Diputacio). But we never felt threatened. There is a metro station about 10 minutes walk from the hotel (Tetuan). The room is OK, but the bathroom a little strange with a glass door (between the room and the bathroom) that does not close very well... There are plenty of neighberhood places to eat, and a small supermarket across the street. In the lobby they have a computer (fee). All in all an OK stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Real_Vacations
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, knowledgable staff, amazing service. Rooms are quite big and clean, just try to get a room on the back side not close to the window, too much noise. Good location, only 3 blocks away from the metro station and close to the sagarada familia cathedral. A wide variety of inexpensive restaurants to choose from in the vecinity. Supermarkets and internet centers are walking distance. Las ramblas are a 20 minute walk from the hotel but I would highly recomend you take the turist bus for 48 hours it will only cost you 26 euros and it will give you the opportunity to visit all the main atractions for 48 hours, hop on and off all you like. Dont take the breakfast its too expensive considering that for the same amount of money you can have a beter breakfast outside the hotel.The hotel was a great experience but unfortunately my personal opinion is that barcelona lacks tourist attractions, most attractions only center themselves in Gaudi projects. For youg people that like to party its an excellent place due to the wide variety of discos and bars that offer Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and good location”
Reviews.Author: Kazlet
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia Carlit is conveniently located 5 minutes walk from the metro, and 15 minutes walk from the Sagrada Familia. I had a single room which was clean, comfortable and quiet (except for the person down the hall who crashed back to their room at 3am). The view was a mixture of local flats, with the spires of the Sagrada Familia in the distance. The staff were friendly and helpful (if you want to sight-see after checking out, there is a room to leave your luggage in). I didn't opt for the over-priced buffet breakfast (11.75 Euros), but instead went to a local cafe and got wonderful coffee & croissant for 2 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spak
Reviews.Content: For what you pay, this is a great little hotel, it is cheap, yet modern and clean, and in a great location within Barcelona. It is a 10-15 minute walk to the town centre, and only a few hundred yards away from the bus station, which we arrived at after our flight into Varedero. I would highly recommend this hotel, the staff were helpful and professional, and the facilites were nice too. Its not the Ritz, but it is surprisingly modern and well decorated. By the way, if you fly to Barcelona from Bristol with Ryanair, you dont land in Barcelona, you land in Varedero - a good hour - two hours away. there is a bus service from the airport, but it is not directly linked with Ryanair, so check if there will be a bus for you when your flight arrives. Ryanair were very cheaky doing this and lots of people on our flight were very annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Suitably Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Happywheninair
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights in the middle of May. The location is great (pretty close to Sagrada Familia), but a bit further away from other attractions. We walked to most places; I would say that it took about 20mins to walk into the centre where Las Ramblas, the cathedral and Musee Picasso are. There are several Metro stations near the hotel for those who would prefer not to waste time walking. The staff were very friendly and helpful and, despite our best efforts to speak Spanish, they spoke excellent English. The room was immaculate, we had aircon, an ensuite bathroom with a shower and our own balcony. My only issue with the hotel was that as breakfast was not included in our package, we had to pay for it... that would have been fine except that it cost 11 Euros per person, per day- which I think is a bit dear. There was a range of food on offer however, pastries, breakfast cereals, fruit and the like. Based on how you book the hotel perhaps you'll be lucky enough to have breakfast included in your package (then you won't notice how expensive it is!). Breakfast aside, I have only positive things to say about this hotel. It comes highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: InesO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hesperia Carlit for 3 nights in February 2007 and thought it was great. Very clean, polite personnel and breakfast was delicous, the location is great too. What else to ask in Barcelona, where hotel prices are far too expensive?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern place, free internet”
Reviews.Author: averell23
Reviews.Content: I came here for a conference, and stayed at the hotel for four days. I got a single room on the ground floor, with a single room to the central courtyard. The room had a modern, clean style which I really liked, and also it was fairly basic, the place didn't feel "budgety" at all. There was only a window to the central "courtyard", which looked rather nice - I really like this, because it was quiet at night and I still had some work to do. The bathroom was clean and quite large. The staff was also very helpful, and most of them spoke well english well enough to get along. We took the breakfast buffet one day, which was o.k., but we didn't really bother because we'd get some snacks during the day. One of the best things for me was that the hotel offered free and full wireless internet access - just ask at the reception. You can also hook up by cable (the stuff insisted that you "need" the cable, but you don't). All in all, a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Above average budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trompie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hesperia Carlit for one night in October 2005. We were met by a friendly receptionist, but the receptionist could only speak basic English and could not understand some of our questions. However, this did not detract from our stay. The room was small, but met our expectations for a budget-priced hotel. The furnishings were modern, and everything was sparkling clean, including the bathroom. Our room had no external windows, and only a window onto the internal courtyard. This was fine with us, as the room was very quiet. There is limited space to put your luggage, but this should only be a concern if you are travelling with very large or a lot of suitcases. The nearest metro station is about 500m away - an easy walk. Breakfast was available at an additional 10 euro's per person, but we made our way to a bakery just across the street, and had a lovely (and cheap!) breakfast. On checking out, the friendly receptionist was very efficient at booking a taxi for us on our request. Would easily recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Hesperia Carlit
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Diputacion 383, 08013 Barcelona, Spain
